questions.question: 'আয়কর' কোন সমাস?
questions.explanation: ব্যাসবাক্যের মাঝের পদ লোপ পেয়ে যে সমাস হয়, তাকে মধ্যপদলোপী কর্মধারয় সমাস বলে। যেমন: সিংহ চিহ্নিত যে আসন = সিংহাসন; আয়ের ওপর অর্পিত যে কর = আয়কর।

questions.question: Denationalization' শব্দটির বাংলা পরিভাষা কোনটি?
উনপঞ্চাশ বায়ু' বান্ধারাটির অর্থ কী?
questions.explanation: গুরুত্বপূর্ণ বাগধারাঃ উড়ো কথা (গুজব), উভয় সঙ্কট (দুদিকে বিপদ), উচ্ছের ঝাড় (খারাপ বংশ), উঠতে বসতে (যখন-তখন)।

questions.question: বলিলাম, 'পৌঁছে দিতে হবে না, শুধু আলোটা দাও।' কোন গল্পের অংশ?
questions.explanation: উক্তিটি 'বিলাসী' গল্পের গল্পকথক ন্যাড়ার। শরৎচন্দ্র চট্টোপাধ্যায়ের 'বিলাসী' গল্পটি প্রথম প্রকাশিত হয় 'ভারতী' পত্রিকার ১৩৫২ বঙ্গাব্দের (১৯১৮ খ্রি.) বৈশাখ সংখ্যায়।

questions.question: Read the following passage and choose the best answer for questions: The sheer number of people. in a.group affects the amount of communication. Consider the difference between communication between two friends and communication in a group of five people. When friends talk, there are two people sending and receiving messages. In a group of five, there are five people doing the same thing. Each idea that is expressed must be understood by four others, who may also choose to respond. Consequently, the greater number of people in a group, the fewer contributions an individual may make. Because there are disadvantanges to large groups, you might assume that small groups would be the most effective. However; groups can be too small as well as 100 people large. With too few members, a group has limited resources, which eliminates a primary advantage of groups for decision making. Also, members may be unwilling to disagree or criticize each other's ideas. Five to seven members is the ideal size for a small group. 28.1. According to the passage, small groups——

options.label: ক
options.text: xpress their criticism more freely than large groups

options.label: গ
options.text: can have some disadvantages as well.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: are unable to decide at the end of discussions.

questions.option_a: xpress their criticism more freely than large groups
questions.option_c: can have some disadvantages as well.
questions.option_d: are unable to decide at the end of discussions.
questions.explanation: Passage অনুযায়ী ছোট গ্রুপ বড় গ্রুপের চেয়ে অধিক স্বাধীনভাবে সমালোচনা প্রকাশ করতে পারে।

questions.question: Port of Payra is situated in which of the following district of Bangladesh?
questions.explanation: The Port of Payra is a small seaport in southern Bangladesh. It was established by an Act of Parliament in 2013. The port was officially inaugurated in 2016. It is located on the Ramnabad Channel near the Bay of Bengal.

questions.question: Two heavenly bodies are respectively 8.9 × 10 8 8.9 \times 10^{8} 8.9 × 1 0 8 miles and 2.7 × 10 7 2.7 \times 10^{7} 2.7 × 1 0 7 miles distant from the earth. Approximately how much farther way from the earth is the first than the second?
questions.explanation: The farther way from the earth the first than second is = ( 8.9 × 10 8 ) − ( 2.7 × 10 7 ) = 8.6 × 10 8 =\left(8.9 \times 10^{8}\right)-\left(2.7 \times 10^{7}\right)=8.6 \times 10^{8} = ( 8.9 × 1 0 8 ) − ( 2.7 × 1 0 7 ) = 8.6 × 1 0 8

questions.question: The average (arithmetic mean) of four numbers is 4 x + 3 4 x+3 4 x + 3 . If one of the numbers is x x x , what is the average of the other three number?
questions.explanation: Total of four number = 4 ( 4 x + 3 ) = 16 x + 12 =4(4 x+3)=16 x+12 = 4 ( 4 x + 3 ) = 16 x + 12 ∴ \therefore ∴ Total of three number = 16 x + 12 − x =16 x+12-x = 16 x + 12 − x [ ∵ [\because [ ∵ one of the number is x ] = 15 x + 12 x]=15 x+12 x ] = 15 x + 12 ∴ \therefore ∴ Average of three number = 15 x + 12 3 = 3 ( 5 x + 4 ) 3 = 5 x + 4 =\frac{15 x+12}{3}=\frac{3(5 x+4)}{3}=5 x+4 = 3 15 x + 12 ​ = 3 3 ( 5 x + 4 ) ​ = 5 x + 4

questions.question: One gram of fat contains 9 calories. An 1,800 calorie diet allows no more than 20 % \mathbf{2 0 \%} 20% calories from fat. How many grams of fat are allowed in that diet?
questions.explanation: The total calories from fat = 1800 × 20 % =1800 \times 20 \% = 1800 × 20% = 1800 × 20 100 = 360 =1800 \times \frac{20}{100}=360 = 1800 × 100 20 ​ = 360 ∴ \therefore ∴ The fat are allowed in that diet = 360 9 = 40 =\frac{360}{9}=40 = 9 360 ​ = 40 gram. [ ∵ 1 [\because 1 [ ∵ 1 gram fat = 9 =9 = 9 calories ] ] ]

questions.question: United Telephone charges a base rate of $10.00 for service, plus an additional charge of $0.25 per minute. Atlantic Call charges a base rate of $12.00 for service, plus an additional charge of $0.20 per minute. For what number of minutes would the bills for each telephone company be the same?
questions.explanation: Let, Bill will same for x minute. According to the question, 10 + .25 x = 12 + .20 x ⇒ .05 x = 2 ∴ x = 40 10+.25 x=12+.20 x \Rightarrow .05 x=2 \therefore x=40 10 + .25 x = 12 + .20 x ⇒ .05 x = 2 ∴ x = 40

questions.question: Machine A fills soda bottles at a constant rate of 60 bottles every 12 minutes and Machines B fills soda bottles at a constant rate of 120 bottles every 8 minutes. How many bottles can both machines working together at their respective rates fill-in 25 minutes?
questions.explanation: Rate of machine A A A A = 60 12  bottle  / m i n = 5  bottle  / m i n \begin{array}{l} \mathrm{A}=\frac{60}{12} \text { bottle } / \mathrm{min} \\ =5 \text { bottle } / \mathrm{min} \end{array} A = 12 60 ​  bottle  / min = 5  bottle  / min ​ Rate of machine B = 120 8 B=\frac{120}{8} B = 8 120 ​ bottle / m i n = 15 / \mathrm{min}=15 / min = 15 bottle / m i n / \mathrm{min} / min Together machine A A A and B B B can fill in a minute = ( 5 + 15 ) =(5+15) = ( 5 + 15 ) bottle = 20 =20 = 20 bottle ∴ \therefore ∴ In 25 minutes together A and B can fill = 20 × 25 = 500 =20 \times 25=500 = 20 × 25 = 500 bottle

questions.question: In a tank are 50L water and 20L of acid. How many liters of water must be evaporated to make the solution 40% acid?

In new solution acid will be 40 % 40 \% 40% , that means water will be 60 % 60 \% 60% According to the question, 50 − x = ( 70 − x ) × 60 100 50-\mathrm{x}=(70-\mathrm{x}) \times \frac{60}{100} 50 − x = ( 70 − x ) × 100 60 ​ ⇒ 250 − 5 x = 210 − 3 x ⇒ 2 x = 40 ∴ x = 20 \begin{array}{l} \Rightarrow 250-5 x=210-3 x \\ \Rightarrow 2 x=40 \therefore x=20 \end{array} ⇒ 250 − 5 x = 210 − 3 x ⇒ 2 x = 40 ∴ x = 20 ​

questions.question: Twelve identical machines, running continuously at the same constant rate, take 8 days to complete a shipment. How many additional machines, each running at the same constant rate, would be needed to reduce the time required to complete a shipment by 2 days?
questions.explanation: If we want to reduce the time for 2 days, then we have to complete the shipment = ( 8 − 2 ) =(8-2) = ( 8 − 2 ) days = 6 =6 = 6 days. In 8 days can complete 12 machines ∴ " 1 " " 12 × 8 " ∴ " " 12 × 8 6 " = 16  machines.  \begin{array}{l} \therefore " 1 " \quad " \quad 12 \times 8 " \\ \therefore " \quad " \quad \frac{12 \times 8}{6} "=16 \text { machines. } \end{array} ∴ "1" " 12 × 8" ∴ " " 6 12 × 8 ​ " = 16  machines.  ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ The additional machines are = ( 16 − 12 ) = 4 =(16-12)=4 = ( 16 − 12 ) = 4 .

questions.question: Choose the number that is 1 4 \frac{1}{4} 4 1 ​ of 1 2 \frac{1}{2} 2 1 ​ of 1 5 \frac{1}{5} 5 1 ​ of 200 :

Preeti has monėy in two separate bank accounts. Account X earns 8% interest annually and account Y earns 15% interest annually. Preeti earned a total of $53 in interest last year. If the total amount of money is the accounts at the beginning of last year was $400, and there were no other deposits or withdrawals, how much money was in account Y?
questions.explanation: For Account  X ,  Principle,  P 1 = P  Interest,  = I 1  Rate,  r 1 = 8 % ∴ I 1 = P 1 ⋅ n 1 ⋅ r 1 = P ⋅ 1 ⋅ 8 100 = 2 p 25 \begin{array}{l}\text { For Account } X, \\ \text { Principle, } P_{1}=P \\ \text { Interest, }=I_{1} \\ \text { Rate, } r_{1}=8 \% \\ \therefore I_{1}=P_{1} \cdot n_{1} \cdot r_{1} \\ \qquad=P \cdot 1 \cdot \frac{8}{100}=\frac{2 p}{25}\end{array}  For Account  X ,  Principle,  P 1 ​ = P  Interest,  = I 1 ​  Rate,  r 1 ​ = 8% ∴ I 1 ​ = P 1 ​ ⋅ n 1 ​ ⋅ r 1 ​ = P ⋅ 1 ⋅ 100 8 ​ = 25 2 p ​ ​ For Account, Y Principle, P 2 = 400 − P \mathrm{P}_{2}=400-\mathrm{P} P 2 ​ = 400 − P Interest = I 2 =\mathrm{I}_{2} = I 2 ​ Rate, r 2 = 15 % \mathrm{r}_{2}=15 \% r 2 ​ = 15% ∴ I 2 = ( 400 − P ) ⋅ 1 ⋅ 15 100 = 1200 20 − 3 p 20 = 60 − 3 p 20 \begin{aligned} \therefore I_{2} & =(400-P) \cdot 1 \cdot \frac{15}{100} \\ & =\frac{1200}{20}-\frac{3 \mathrm{p}}{20}=60-\frac{3 \mathrm{p}}{20} \end{aligned} ∴ I 2 ​ ​ = ( 400 − P ) ⋅ 1 ⋅ 100 15 ​ = 20 1200 ​ − 20 3 p ​ = 60 − 20 3 p ​ ​ A.Q. I 1 + I 2 = 53 ⇒ 2 p 25 + 60 − 3 p 20 = 53 ⇒ 8 p − 15 p 100 = − 7 ⇒ P = 700 7 = 100 \begin{array}{l} I_{1}+I_{2}=53 \\ \Rightarrow \frac{2 p}{25}+60-\frac{3 p}{20}=53 \Rightarrow \frac{8 p-15 p}{100}=-7 \Rightarrow P=\frac{700}{7}=100 \end{array} I 1 ​ + I 2 ​ = 53 ⇒ 25 2 p ​ + 60 − 20 3 p ​ = 53 ⇒ 100 8 p − 15 p ​ = − 7 ⇒ P = 7 700 ​ = 100 ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ Principle of account Y = 400 − 100 = 300 Y=400-100=300 Y = 400 − 100 = 300

questions.option_d: P D X \frac{P D}{X} X P D ​
questions.explanation: Total persons = P =P = P The price of van = x =x = x ∴ \therefore ∴ Each person should pay = x p =\frac{x}{p} = p x ​ After cancelling the trip, the person becomes = P − D =\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D} = P − D . Now, Each person have to pay = X P − D =\frac{X}{P-D} = P − D X ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ Additional dollars = x P − D − x P = x P − x P + D x P ( P − D ) = D x P ( P − D ) =\frac{\mathrm{x}}{\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D}}-\frac{\mathrm{x}}{\mathrm{P}}=\frac{\mathrm{xP}-\mathrm{xP}+\mathrm{Dx}}{\mathrm{P}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})}=\frac{\mathrm{Dx}}{\mathrm{P}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})} = P − D x ​ − P x ​ = P ( P − D ) xP − xP + Dx ​ = P ( P − D ) Dx ​

questions.question: At a conference, 12 members shook hands with each other before & after the meeting. How many total number of handshakes occurred?
questions.explanation: The total number of hand shakes = 2 × 12 C 2 = 132 =2 \times{ }^{12} \mathrm{C}_{2}=132 = 2 × 12 C 2 ​ = 132

questions.question: The day before the day before yesterday is five days after Saturday. What day is it today?
questions.explanation: The day before the day before yesterday = 3 =3 = 3 days. Five days after Saturday = = = Thursday Thursday +3 days = = = Sunday.

questions.question: A man is asked what his daughters look like, He answers, "They are all blondes, but two, all brunettes, but three, and all redheads, but three." How many daughters did he have?
questions.explanation: The man has 3 daughters

questions.question: What is the missing number in this series? 72611 ? 121713 72611 ? 121713 72611 ? 121713
Three of the following four are alike in respect to their position in the English alphabet and hence form a group. Which one does not belong to that group?
questions.explanation: After presentation the options by their position in the English alphabet we get, There is a sequence, 3 more from the first position. But UXA and SVZ does not follow the sequence.

questions.question: A square garden is surrounded by a path of uniform width. If the path and the garden each have an area of x x x , then what is the width of the path in terms of x x x ?
questions.explanation: Let, the side of the square garden = a =a = a and the width at the path = d =\mathrm{d} = d . A.Q. ( a + 2 d ) 2 − a 2 = x ⇒ a 2 + 4 d a + 4 d 2 − a 2 = x ⇒ 4 d 2 + 4 a d + x = 2 x ⇒ ( 2 d ) 2 + 2 ⋅ 2 d ⋅ x + ( x ) 2 = 2 x [ ∵ a 2 = x ⇒ a = x ] ⇒ ( 2 d + x ) 2 = 2 x ⇒ 2 d + x = 2 x ⇒ 2 d = 2 ⋅ x − x ∴ d = 2 x 2 − x 2 \begin{array}{l} (a+2 d)^{2}-a^{2}=x \\ \Rightarrow a^{2}+4 d a+4 d^{2}-a^{2}=x \Rightarrow 4 d^{2}+4 a d+x=2 x \\ \Rightarrow(2 d)^{2}+2 \cdot 2 d \cdot \sqrt{x}+(\sqrt{x})^{2}=2 x\left[\because a^{2}=x \Rightarrow a=\sqrt{x}\right] \\ \Rightarrow(2 d+\sqrt{x})^{2}=2 x \Rightarrow 2 d+\sqrt{x}=\sqrt{2} x \Rightarrow 2 d=\sqrt{2} \cdot x-\sqrt{x} \\ \therefore d=\frac{\sqrt{2} x}{2}-\frac{\sqrt{x}}{2} \end{array} ( a + 2 d ) 2 − a 2 = x ⇒ a 2 + 4 d a + 4 d 2 − a 2 = x ⇒ 4 d 2 + 4 a d + x = 2 x ⇒ ( 2 d ) 2 + 2 ⋅ 2 d ⋅ x ​ + ( x ​ ) 2 = 2 x [ ∵ a 2 = x ⇒ a = x ​ ] ⇒ ( 2 d + x ​ ) 2 = 2 x ⇒ 2 d + x ​ = 2 ​ x ⇒ 2 d = 2 ​ ⋅ x − x ​ ∴ d = 2 2 ​ x ​ − 2 x ​ ​ ​

questions.question: The area of circle W W W is 16 n 16 n 16 n and the area of circle Z Z Z is 4 n 4 n 4 n . What is the ratio of the circumference of W W W to the circumference of Z Z Z ?
questions.explanation: Let, the radius of W = R W=R W = R and the radius of Z = r Z=r Z = r A.Q. π R 2 π r 2 = 16 n 4 n ⇒ R r = 2 1 ⇒ 2 π R 2 π r = 2 1 = 2  to  1 \frac{\pi \mathrm{R}^{2}}{\pi \mathrm{r}^{2}}=\frac{16 \mathrm{n}}{4 \mathrm{n}} \Rightarrow \frac{\mathrm{R}}{\mathrm{r}}=\frac{2}{1} \Rightarrow \frac{2 \pi \mathrm{R}}{2 \pi \mathrm{r}}=\frac{2}{1}=2 \text { to } 1 π r 2 π R 2 ​ = 4 n 16 n ​ ⇒ r R ​ = 1 2 ​ ⇒ 2 π r 2 π R ​ = 1 2 ​ = 2  to  1

questions.question: An observer 1.6 m tall is 20 3   m 20 \sqrt{3} \mathrm{~m} 20 3 ​   m away from a tower. The angle of elevation from his eye to the top of the tower is 30 ∘ 30^{\circ} 3 0 ∘ . The height of the tower is:
questions.explanation: Let, the height of the tower from the eye level of the observer = h =\mathbf{h} = h ∴ h 20 3 = tan ⁡ 30 ∘ ⇒ h = 20 3 3 ∴ h = 20. \begin{array}{l} \therefore \frac{\mathrm{h}}{20 \sqrt{3}}=\tan 30^{\circ} \\ \Rightarrow \mathrm{h}=\frac{20 \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}} \therefore \mathrm{h}=20 . \end{array} ∴ 20 3 ​ h ​ = tan 3 0 ∘ ⇒ h = 3 ​ 20 3 ​ ​ ∴ h = 20. ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ The height of the tower = h + 1.6 = 20 + 1.6 = 21.6   m =\mathrm{h}+1.6=20+1.6=21.6 \mathrm{~m} = h + 1.6 = 20 + 1.6 = 21.6   m .

questions.question: In the figure A D = 4 , A B = 3 A D=4, A B=3 A D = 4 , A B = 3 and C D = 9 C D=9 C D = 9 . What is the area of triangle AEC?
questions.explanation: △ A B E \triangle \mathrm{ABE} △ ABE and △ C D E \triangle \mathrm{CDE} △ CDE are similar. [ ∵ [\because [ ∵ All three angles are equal] That means the ratio of corresponding sides in these triangles are equal (corresponding sides are opposite equal angle). ∴ C D A B = D E A E = 9 3 = 3 ⇒ D E = 3 A E \therefore \frac{\mathrm{CD}}{\mathrm{AB}}=\frac{\mathrm{DE}}{\mathrm{AE}}=\frac{9}{3}=3 \Rightarrow \mathrm{DE}=3 \mathrm{AE} ∴ AB CD ​ = AE DE ​ = 3 9 ​ = 3 ⇒ DE = 3 AE Now, A D = A E + D E ⇒ 4 = A E + 3 A E ⇒ A E = 1 \mathrm{AD}=\mathrm{AE}+\mathrm{DE} \Rightarrow 4=\mathrm{AE}+3 \mathrm{AE} \Rightarrow \mathrm{AE}=1 AD = AE + DE ⇒ 4 = AE + 3 AE ⇒ AE = 1 . △ A C E = △ A C D − △ C D E \triangle \mathrm{ACE}=\triangle \mathrm{ACD}-\triangle \mathrm{CDE} △ ACE = △ ACD − △ CDE = 1 2 × ( =\frac{1}{2} \times( = 2 1 ​ × ( base × \times × height ) − 1 2 × ( )-\frac{1}{2} \times( ) − 2 1 ​ × ( base × \times × height ) ) ) = 1 2 × C D × A D − 1 2 × C D × D E =\frac{1}{2} \times C D \times A D-\frac{1}{2} \times C D \times D E = 2 1 ​ × C D × A D − 2 1 ​ × C D × D E = 1 2 × 9 × 4 − 1 2 × 9 × 3 [ ∵ A E = 1 =\frac{1}{2} \times 9 \times 4-\frac{1}{2} \times 9 \times 3 \quad[\because \mathrm{AE}=1 = 2 1 ​ × 9 × 4 − 2 1 ​ × 9 × 3 [ ∵ AE = 1 , then D E = 3 , A E = 3 ] \mathrm{DE}=3, \mathrm{AE}=3] DE = 3 , AE = 3 ] = 18 − 27 2 = 36 − 27 2 = 9 2 = 4.5 =18-\frac{27}{2}=\frac{36-27}{2}=\frac{9}{2}=4.5 = 18 − 2 27 ​ = 2 36 − 27 ​ = 2 9 ​ = 4.5

questions.question: A certain pet store sells on dogs and cats. In March, the store sold twice as many dogs as cats. In April, the store sold twice the number of dogs that it sold in March, and three times the number of cats that it sold in March. If the total number of pets the store sold in March and April combined was 500, how many dogs did the store sell in March?
questions.explanation: Sell in march, and Sell in April,   Let, cat  = x dog ⁡ = 2.2 x = 4 x ∴  dog  = 2 x  cat  = 3. x = 3 x  A.Q.  x + 2 x + 4 x + 3 x = 500 ⇒ 10 x = 500 ∴ x = 50 \begin{array}{l} \text { Sell in march, and Sell in April, } \\ \text { Let, cat }=x \quad \operatorname{dog}=2.2 \mathrm{x}=4 \mathrm{x} \\ \therefore \text { dog }=2 \mathrm{x} \quad \text { cat }=3 . \mathrm{x}=3 \mathrm{x} \\ \text { A.Q. } x+2 x+4 x+3 x=500 \\ \Rightarrow 10 \mathrm{x}=500 \quad \therefore \mathrm{x}=50 \end{array}  Sell in march, and Sell in April,   Let, cat  = x dog = 2.2 x = 4 x ∴  dog  = 2 x  cat  = 3. x = 3 x  A.Q.  x + 2 x + 4 x + 3 x = 500 ⇒ 10 x = 500 ∴ x = 50 ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ In March number of dog sold = 2 x = 2 × 50 = 100 =2 x=2 \times 50=100 = 2 x = 2 × 50 = 100

questions.question: If n is a positive integer and 10n is a factor of m, what is the value of n? (i) m is the product of the first positive 40 numbers (ii) n >8*m/40!

options.label: ক
options.text: Statement (i) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (ii) alone is not sufficient,

options.label: খ
options.text: Statement (ii) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (i) alone is not sufficient

options.label: গ
options.text: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is suffficient

questions.option_a: Statement (i) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (ii) alone is not sufficient,
questions.option_b: Statement (ii) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (i) alone is not sufficient
questions.option_c: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is suffficient

questions.question: x x x and y y y are integers. x + y < 11 x+y<11 x + y < 11 , and x > 6 x>6 x > 6 . What is the smallest possible value of x − y x-y x − y ?
questions.explanation: Given that, x + y < 11 x+y<11 x + y < 11 - (i) and x > 6 x>6 x > 6 - (ii) From (i) and (ii) We understand that, x+y=7+3=10<11 [ x>6 and x+y ] that means the value of x x x may be 7 , 8 , 9 7,8,9 7 , 8 , 9 and the value of y y y may be 1 , 2 , 3 1,2,3 1 , 2 , 3 . So, the smallest value of x − y = x-y= x − y = Lowest value of x x x - highest value of y = 7 − 3 = 4 y=7-3=4 y = 7 − 3 = 4

questions.question: Let x , y x, y x , y and z z z be distinct integers. x x x and y y y are even and positive, and z z z is odd and positive. Which one of the following statements cannot be true?

options.label: ক
options.text: ( x − z ) 2 y (x-z)^{2} y ( x − z ) 2 y is even

options.label: খ
options.text: ( x − y ) 2 z (x-y)^{2} z ( x − y ) 2 z is even

options.label: গ
options.text: ( y − z ) z (y-z) z ( y − z ) z is odd

options.label: ঘ
options.text: ( x − z ) y 2 (\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{z}) \mathrm{y}^{2} ( x − z ) y 2 is odd

questions.option_a: ( x − z ) 2 y (x-z)^{2} y ( x − z ) 2 y is even
questions.option_b: ( x − y ) 2 z (x-y)^{2} z ( x − y ) 2 z is even
questions.option_c: ( y − z ) z (y-z) z ( y − z ) z is odd
questions.option_d: ( x − z ) y 2 (\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{z}) \mathrm{y}^{2} ( x − z ) y 2 is odd
questions.explanation: ( x − z ) 2 y = (  even  −  odd  ) 2 ×  even  = (  odd  ) 2 ×  even   odd  ×  even  =  even.  ( x − y ) 2 z = (  even  −  even  ) 2 ×  odd  = (  even  ) 2 ×  odd  =  even  ×  odd  =  even  \begin{aligned} (x-z)^{2} y= & (\text { even }- \text { odd })^{2} \times \text { even }=(\text { odd })^{2} \times \text { even } \\ \quad & \text { odd } \times \text { even }=\text { even. } \\ (x-y)^{2} z= & (\text { even }- \text { even })^{2} \times \text { odd }=(\text { even })^{2} \times \text { odd } \\ & =\text { even } \times \text { odd }=\text { even } \end{aligned} ( x − z ) 2 y = ( x − y ) 2 z = ​ (  even  −  odd  ) 2 ×  even  = (  odd  ) 2 ×  even   odd  ×  even  =  even.  (  even  −  even  ) 2 ×  odd  = (  even  ) 2 ×  odd  =  even  ×  odd  =  even  ​ ( y − z ) z = ( (y-z) z=( ( y − z ) z = ( even - odd ) × ( ) \times( ) × ( odd - odd = = = odd ( x − z ) y 2 = ( (x-z) y^{2}=( ( x − z ) y 2 = ( even - odd ) × (  even  ) 2 = ) \times(\text { even })^{2}= ) × (  even  ) 2 = odd × \times × even = = = even but in option we have ( x − z ) y 2 (x-z) y^{2} ( x − z ) y 2 is odd. So it cann't be true

questions.question: If ( x + 2 ) 2 = 9 (x+2)^{2}=9 ( x + 2 ) 2 = 9 and ( y + 3 ) 2 = 25 (y+3)^{2}=25 ( y + 3 ) 2 = 25 then the maximum value of x y \frac{x}{y} y x ​ ?
questions.explanation: Given that, and ( x + 2 ) 2 = 9 (x+2)^{2}=9 ( x + 2 ) 2 = 9 ( y + 3 ) 2 = 25 ⇒ y + 3 = ± 5 ∴ y = 2 , − 8 \begin{array}{l} (y+3)^{2}=25 \\ \Rightarrow y+3= \pm 5 \\ \therefore y=2,-8 \end{array} ( y + 3 ) 2 = 25 ⇒ y + 3 = ± 5 ∴ y = 2 , − 8 ​ ⇒ x + 2 = ± 3 ∴ x = 1 , − 5 \begin{array}{l} \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}+2= \pm 3 \\ \therefore \mathrm{x}=1,-5 \end{array} ⇒ x + 2 = ± 3 ∴ x = 1 , − 5 ​ We have to determine the maximum value of x y \frac{x}{y} y x ​ . So, we have to avoid the negative value of x y \frac{x}{y} y x ​ . Its possible when both of x x x and y y y are positive or negative. ∴ x y = 1 2 = .5 , x y = − 5 − 8 = .625 \therefore \frac{x}{y}=\frac{1}{2}=.5, \quad \frac{x}{y}=\frac{-5}{-8}=.625 ∴ y x ​ = 2 1 ​ = .5 , y x ​ = − 8 − 5 ​ = .625

questions.question: Being a conscientious driver, Suzy stayed at or below the speed limit while travelling down the interstate. Overall, she went an average rate of 65 mph and it took her 10 hours to complets her mph and it took her 10 hours to complete her journey. If she travelled for 6 \mathbf{6} 6 of her 10 hours at 70 mph , what constant speed ( mph ) did she go for the remaining 4 hours to obtain the overall 65 mph average?
questions.explanation: In her journey, Suzy totally drive = 65 × 10 =65 \times 10 = 65 × 10 [ ∵ \because ∵ average speed is 65 mph at 10 hours] = 650 =650 = 650 mile. But 6 hours she travelled at 70 mph . So, in this time she went = 70 × 6 =70 \times 6 = 70 × 6 mile = 420 =420 = 420 mile. ∴ \therefore ∴ Remaining Distance = ( 650 − 420 ) =(650-420) = ( 650 − 420 ) mile = 230 =230 = 230 mile. ∴ \therefore ∴ Rest 4 hours she drived at = 230 4 = 57.5 m p h =\frac{230}{4}=57.5 \mathrm{mph} = 4 230 ​ = 57.5 mph .
